Package fr.univparis.metro

Class WGraph<T>

java.lang.Object
fr.univparis.metro.WGraph<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable
public class WGraph<T>
extends Object
implements Cloneable
A weighted graph class

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    WGraph()
    Creates an empty Weighted Graph

  • Method Details

    • clone

      public WGraph<T> clone()
      Creates a clone of the graph. Vertices will not be clone
      Overrides:
      clone in class Object
      Returns:
      a clone of the WGraph

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(WGraph<T> g)
      Returns true if and only if the instance graph and the parameter graph represent the same network
      Parameters:
      g - the WGraph to compare with the WGraph
      Returns:
      True if and only if the instance graph and the parameter graph represent the same network

    • getVertices

      public Set<T> getVertices()
      Returns a set of all the vertices in the graph.
      Returns:
      a set of all the vertices in the graph.

    • nbVertex

      public int nbVertex()
      Returns the number of vertices of the WGraph
      Returns:
      the number of vertices of the WGraph

    • neighbors

      public Set<T> neighbors​(T vertex)
      Returns the neighbors of a vertex contained in the graph.
      Parameters:
      vertex - the vertex which we want the neighbors.
      Returns:
      the set of all the vertices that can be reach by the parameter vertex

    • weight

      public Double weight​(T s, T p)
      Returns the weight between two vertices
      Parameters:
      s - the start of the edge
      p - the end of the edge
      Returns:
      the weight between the vertex s and the vertex p.

    • addVertex

      public boolean addVertex​(T v)
      Adds a vertex to the graph.
      Parameters:
      v - the vertex we want to add.
      Returns:
      true if v has been added.

    • deleteVertex

      public boolean deleteVertex​(T v)
      Deletes a vertex of the graph and all the edges that are link to it
      Parameters:
      v - the vertex we want to delete
      Returns:
      true if v has been deleted, false if the vertex hasn't be found.

    • addEdge

      public boolean addEdge​(T s, T p, Double weight)
      Adds an edge between two vertices
      Parameters:
      s - the start of the edge.
      p - the end of the edge.
      weight - the weight of the edge.
      Returns:
      true if the edge has correctly been added, else false (occurs when one of the vertex is vertex is not in this graph or that there is already an edge).

    • removeEdge

      public boolean removeEdge​(T s, T p)
      Removes an edge
      Parameters:
      s - the start of the edge.
      p - the end of the edge.
      Returns:
      true if the edge has correctly been removed (false occurs when the specified edge don't exist).

    • addDoubleEdge

      public boolean addDoubleEdge​(T e, Double weight, Predicate<T> p)
      Adds double edge between the specified vertex and all the other vertices that satifies a condition
      Parameters:
      e - one end of every added edge
      weight - the weight for the added edges
      p - an edge between the specified vertex and any other edges will be added if the other vertex satifiy this predicate
      Returns:
      true if and only if the specified vertex is in the graph, else no edge will be add.

    • nbVertex

      public int nbVertex​(Predicate<T> p)
      Return the number of Vertices that satifies a condition
      Parameters:
      p - The condition for every vertex
      Returns:
      The number of vertex that evaluate true with predicate p

    • vertexToString

      public String vertexToString​(Predicate<T> p)
      Return a String containing the Object.toString() funtion of every vertex that evualuate true with predicate p
      Parameters:
      p - The predicate to test with every vertex
      Returns:
      a String containing the toString funtion of every vertex that evualuate true with predicate p

    • containsVertex

      public boolean containsVertex​(T s)
      Inidicates the presence of the specified vertex in the graph
      Parameters:
      s - the vertex we want know the presence in the graph
      Returns:
      true if and only if the specified vertex is in the graph

    • setWeight

      public void setWeight​(T s, T p, Double weight)
      Modifies the weight between two vertices
      Parameters:
      s - the start of the edge
      p - the end of the edge
      weight - the new weight of the edge

    • apply

      public void apply​(WGraph<T> g)
      Adds and modifies the vertices and eges that are in the specified graph into the instance graph. If a vertex of the specified graph is not in the instance graph it will be added. Same for the edges. If an edges between is in both graph the weight in the instance graph will be modify with the weight in the specified graph.
      Parameters:
      g - the graph containing all the modification that we want to apply to the isntance graph

    • splitVertex

      public void splitVertex​(T old, T newVert1, T newVert2)
      Removes a vertex and replace it by two vertex wich will have the same edges.
      Parameters:
      old - the vertex we want to split into two vertices
      newVert1 - one of the new vertex that replace old
      newVert2 - the other new vertex that replace old
